summary: This is an email chain from August 23, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding a forwarded voice message. The message inquires about potential investigative actions concerning Jeffrey Epstein's properties in New Mexico. The email shows internal coordination on the matter.

persons.name: M, 1
persons.role: Email sender/recipient, likely U.S. Attorney's Office personnel
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the top email, responding to a forwarded message and indicating they will follow up on Monday.

persons.name: M, (USANYS) 3
persons.role: Email sender/recipient, U.S. Attorney's Office personnel
persons.context: Forwards a voice message inquiry about Epstein properties in New Mexico to colleagues, noting they are on vacation the following week.

connections.description: Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, coordinating on a work-related inquiry about Epstein properties.

events.title: Inquiry about Epstein New Mexico properties
events.description: A voice message is received and forwarded within the U.S. Attorney's Office, inquiring if any actions are being taken regarding Jeffrey Epstein's properties in New Mexico.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York dated August 23, 2019.
It references an inquiry from an unspecified party (possibly law enforcement in New Mexico) about whether any actions were being taken regarding Jeffrey Epstein's properties in New Mexico.
The email shows the matter was being handled internally, with one attorney forwarding it due to upcoming vacation.
The email chain indicates ongoing investigative interest in Epstein's assets and properties following his arrest and death.
